description: BASNet is designed for salient object detection, focusing on accurately segmenting objects from the background by incorporating boundary-awareness into its network architecture. BASNet uses a combination of a U-Net-like architecture for capturing spatial hierarchies and an additional boundary-enhancement module to refine the object boundaries. This approach ensures precise segmentation, making BASNet suitable for applications such as image editing, medical imaging, and autonomous driving.

metrics.inference_time: 50-100 ms per image on NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPU

dependencies.hardware_requirements: GPU (NVIDIA Tesla V100 or similar recommended), CPU

limitations:
- High computational and memory requirements for training and inference.
- Performance may degrade on images with complex backgrounds or low contrast between object and background.
- Requires large, annotated datasets for optimal training.
references:
- Q. Hou, M.-M. Cheng, A. Borji, H. Jiang, and J. Feng, "BASNet: Boundary-Aware Salient Object Detection," in Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), 2019.
- BASNet GitHub Repository: https://github.com/NathanUA/BASNet
- https://arxiv.org/pdf/1903.02719.pdf
